snippet.textDisplay: When you listen to Caverns 1 from the original game, you can only appreciate the work Matsuoka put in this remix: I love the one-two sound starting at 1:00, as well as the hi-hats at 1:40; mixed with the chorus and the strings, it makes for a very deep and menacing ambience perfectly fitting Metroid. I finished Samus Returns this week-end and while it was a solid remake, I just can't put my finger as to why the 10 hours felt so long. It might have to do with the fact that I played AM2R before, which to be honest I find many levels above this game. I don't think I'll ever be a fan of 2.5D games, but I do have to say the 3D effect was very well done when turned on. It just had this generally bland feeling to it. Apart from a boss battle or two, I never really got excited even when I got new upgrades. It's a good game, it just never reached the addictive and wow effect for me.
snippet.textOriginal: When you listen to Caverns 1 from the original game, you can only appreciate the work Matsuoka put in this remix: I love the one-two sound starting at 1:00, as well as the hi-hats at 1:40; mixed with the chorus and the strings, it makes for a very deep and menacing ambience perfectly fitting Metroid. I finished Samus Returns this week-end and while it was a solid remake, I just can't put my finger as to why the 10 hours felt so long. It might have to do with the fact that I played AM2R before, which to be honest I find many levels above this game. I don't think I'll ever be a fan of 2.5D games, but I do have to say the 3D effect was very well done when turned on. It just had this generally bland feeling to it. Apart from a boss battle or two, I never really got excited even when I got new upgrades. It's a good game, it just never reached the addictive and wow effect for me.

snippet.textDisplay: Agree with you there.  There are some parts where the game shined but I REALLY didn't care for the counter attack is the answer to everything gimmick and the fact that none of the suit upgrades really did anything.
snippet.textOriginal: Agree with you there.  There are some parts where the game shined but I REALLY didn't care for the counter attack is the answer to everything gimmick and the fact that none of the suit upgrades really did anything.

snippet.textDisplay: I love AM2R and there's several things I like better than in this game, but I still enjoyed this one a little more. Mostly, it was an actual huge 2D Metroid and I actually got lost, like I was really exploring a deep cave. I'd never got lost in a Metroid game before, except possibly Super Metroid, so that was really exciting. I've replayed this already many times.
snippet.textOriginal: I love AM2R and there's several things I like better than in this game, but I still enjoyed this one a little more. Mostly, it was an actual huge 2D Metroid and I actually got lost, like I was really exploring a deep cave. I'd never got lost in a Metroid game before, except possibly Super Metroid, so that was really exciting. I've replayed this already many times.

snippet.textDisplay: I liked battle with Ridley big open space and missiles wear him out
snippet.textOriginal: I liked battle with Ridley big open space and missiles wear him out

snippet.textDisplay:
The reboot was nice in many different ways compared to the original Metroid 2, but sadly you needed a headset to hear all the intruiging parts of the new songs. 
Still damn good though.
snippet.textOriginal:
The reboot was nice in many different ways compared to the original Metroid 2, but sadly you needed a headset to hear all the intruiging parts of the new songs. 
Still damn good though.

snippet.textDisplay: rpgs are my bread and butter, but I would take a remaster for this trilogy in a heartbeat.
snippet.textOriginal: rpgs are my bread and butter, but I would take a remaster for this trilogy in a heartbeat.

snippet.textDisplay: Great stuff! Without knowing what the game even looks like, the music does a lot in terms of instilling images of dreadful sci-fi spacetime anxiety.
snippet.textOriginal: Great stuff! Without knowing what the game even looks like, the music does a lot in terms of instilling images of dreadful sci-fi spacetime anxiety.

snippet.textDisplay: I was wondering when you would put this one up!!! Soundtrack in this game was very atmospheric and memorable!!
snippet.textOriginal: I was wondering when you would put this one up!!! Soundtrack in this game was very atmospheric and memorable!!

snippet.textDisplay: I love the atmosphere of the game. The music fits really well.
snippet.textOriginal: I love the atmosphere of the game. The music fits really well.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm very keen to listen to this...😉
